fields.title: CEREC TOOTH SCANNING
fields.description:
THE TECHNOLOGY OF PREPARATION VENEERS, CROWN SAND IN SETS WITHOUT IMPRINTS.

In order to achieve the form of a future tooth, we can use the removal of imprints (impressions of the teeth) and digital scanning (virtual imprints). Scanning is more precise, quicker and more comfortable.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
SCANNING:
Our doctor runs a special camera the size of a toothbrush along the teeth to get a 3D model.

02
TRANSFER OF A FILE THROUGH A CLOUD:
Through a cloud service, our doctor momentarily transfers results of as canto a Fraser, which prepares crown, an inset ora veneer.

03
INDIVIDUAL WORK OF OUR TECHNICIAN:
After the Fraser, our technician manually brings the natural tooth to the corresponding color and texture

04
REGISTERING OF EXECUTED WORK:
Registering of executed work.
fields.features:
Thanks to scanning technology a new tooth is prepared 2 times faster than with the use of impressions.

The small size of the nozzle of the scanner allows conducting the procedure quickly and without unpleasant sensations.

This technology is suitable for all patients, including those who have a vomiting reflex or an allergy to impression masses.

The sensitive camera conveys all anatomical particularities of the scanned tooth with maximum precision.

fields.title: MICROSCOPE
fields.description:
24-TIME ENHANCEMENT FOR MAXIMUM PRECISION

Our doctors work with state-of-the-art microscopes, which allow them to find the most unnoticeable problematic sections of the teeth and conduct the required treatment with maximum accuracy.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
DIAGNOSTICS:
The use of a microscope often helps to see hidden defective sections of a tooth.

 
02
TREATMENT OF CANALS:
The Canal System Consists Of A Multitude Of Branches, the smallest of which can reach 1mm in size, which is why absolute precision is required here.

 
03
PROSTHESIS AND AESTHETICS:
The beauty and naturalness of your smile depend on the precision of the work of the orthopedist, while the microscope in this work allows to factor in all anatomical particularities of a tooth and conduct its restoration with maximum precision.
fields.features: The Porcelain dental clinic is a reference representative of Carl Zeiss in our country.

fields.title: VIRTUAL OPERATION
fields.description:
VIRTUAL PLANNING REDUCES THE RISKS DURING THE CONDUCTING OF AN OPERATION.

Our doctor tests the course of the operation on a virtual prototype of the patient’s head and determines the best method of conducting it.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
DATA COLLECTION:
We take a series of 3D pictures of the patient and processes them in a special program

 
02
SELECTION OF AN IMPLANT:
On a 3D model, our doctor chooses the size of an implant and its manufacturer, which is most suitable for the given situation.

 
03
DETERMINING THE BEST POSITION FOR THE IMPLANT IN THE BONES:
Our doctor analyzes the thickness, volume and location of the nerves in different sections and projections of the pictures. Then he puts a virtual implant in a virtual bone, choosing the best position by degrees and angles.

 
04
CONDUCTING THE OPERATION:
On the basis of calculations received our doctor conducts the alive operation.
fields.features:
We Can Show You During consultation how exactly we will mount the implant. You will know exactly what is happening and how.

After planning our doctor prepares a special template made of plastic on which the orifice has already been prepared at the required angle.

During the operation itself, our doctor inserts the implant through the template. This reduces the time and guarantees the precision of the work.

fields.title: FILLINGS
fields.description:
YOUR DESIRE THAT A FILLING RESEMBLE YOUR TOOTH AS CLOSELY AS POSSIBLE MEANS WE MUST SELECT A CLEAR CRITERIA OF QUALITY

Today, materials used for preparing fillings are made of nano-composites. They show all the properties of a natural tooth - transparency, durability, individual shades and enamel designs.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
WE DETERMINE WHICH TYPE OF FILLING IS REQUIRED:
There are several generations of composites, each of which has its pluses and minuses. In cases when there are not very many healthy tooth tissues left and the composite filling will not cling to the tooth, we propose a ceramic filling.

 
02
WE CLEAN THE CAVITY AND INSERT A FILLING:
Inserting a filling takes 30 minutes to 1 hour.

 
03
WE THEN POLISH THE FILLING:
We then polish the filling.
fields.features: We make a rational decision and take action accordingly – if it becomes obvious that the filling made of a composite will no longer hold on or will not provide the necessary aesthetic effect, we propose a variant made from a different material.

fields.title: CROWNS
fields.description:
CERAMICS IN CROWNS FOR MAXIMUM IDENTITY OF NATURAL TEETH

A crown helps to restore a severely decayed tooth, return it to its previous form and function and protect it from the formation of cavities later on. These crowns are used in the restoration and treatment of teeth canals and implantation.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
X-RAY:
On the basis of photos the doctor takes into account the pins and the angle of the teeth and then determines how the crowns should settle.

 
02
CHECKING THE TOOTH IMPRESSION OR BITE:
With the help of an articulator we create the biologically correct position and form of the teeth.

 
03
PREPARING THE TOOTH:
The doctor cleans out the cavity and the existing decay.

 
04
REMOVAL OF CASTS OR SCANNING THE TEETH:
Removal of casts or scanning the teeth.

 
05
PREPARATION OF THE CROWN:
Thanks to high pressure and temperature and the layered application of enamel, the technician achieves maximum similarity of the crown to the natural tooth.

 
06
FIXATION:
With the help of a special fixating cement, the doctor very tightly and hermetically mounts the crown on the tooth to prevent bacteria from forming under it.
fields.features:
We offer ceramic crowns, which imitate the structure, color and transparency of natural tooth tissues.

We have the possibility to make a crown on a daily basis thanks to digital scanning and data transfer via the Internet.

Thanks to the use of ceramics you will not become allergic to metal and gray rims will not form on your gums.

fields.title: GUM PLASTICS
fields.description:
A BEAUTIFUL SMILE USA HARMONIOUS COMBINATION OF EVEN WHITE TEETH ANDTHE PROPER FORM OF HEALTHY GUMS.

We often encounter situations where the patient’s teeth are even, have a good color and form, but on one tooth or two the gums seemingly “jumped up” or “dropped”. Then a major differential forms that seriously ruins the smile. In such cases, we advise you have plastics put on your gums to return the to their natural level.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
WE DO AN X-RAY:
On the picture the doctor looks at the level of the bones between the teeth. Relocating the gums is possible only at the level of the bones, otherwise there will be nothing to affix them to.

 
02
WE COMPOSE A PROGNOSIS AND PRESENT IT TO THE CLIENT:
Any procedure requires a concise understanding of the result. On the basis of the X-ray the doctor composes a prognosis as to how much the gums can be relocated and substantiates the plan to the client

 
03
GUM PLASTIC:
There are many methods of how to relocate gums. A fragment of the gums can be removed from the heavens or the patient’s existing gums can be pulled up. The course of the operation depends on each specific case.

 
04
RESULT CONTROL:
It is important to track how your gums are behaving after half a year or more.
fields.features:
Our task – to remove the cause of the problem! If the gums began shifting their position there is definitely a reason for this. Often it is an overburdening of the teeth due to an improper bite. Before doing an operation the doctor must make a decision on how to correct the main cause of the problem.

Changing the level of the gums is important prior to the mounting of veneers or crowns. Not the other way around!

fields.title: EXTRACTING WISDOM TEETH
fields.description:
COMFORTABLE SOLUTION FOR “DIFFICULT” TEETH

When the wisdom teeth begin cutting into the gums, most people shudder.

Experienced surgeons at Porcelain easily perform extraction of even the most complicated teeth. This procedure is painless and safe.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
CONSULTATION AND DIAGNOSTICS:
We take a 3D X-ray on the basis of which the doctor precisely determines the positioning of the teeth and plans the extraction. This allows to rule out all possible difficulties in the course of the procedure. In the case of a complicated extraction of one or several teeth, the procedure can be done while the patient is under medical anesthesia (medicinally induced sleep)..

 
02
EXTRACTION:
After the procedure the doctor gives all possible recommendations of care for the entire period of recovery. After complicated extractions the necessary medication is prescribed.

 
03
CHECK-UP, REMOVAL OF SEAMS:
In 7-10 days the doctor does a check-up of the area of extraction of the tooth and removes the seams.
fields.features:
Thorough preparation allows for doing an extraction quickly and leaving the incision open for the minimal time possible. The fosters quicker recovery of the fibers and less puffiness or swelling.

Only experienced surgeons engage in the extraction of teeth. In complicated cases there is not just one technique used in a tooth extraction operation. It is exactly the experience and knowledge of the surgeon that allows for making the right decision in different situations.

Our doctors can extract even all four wisdom teeth at once while the patient is asleep. We recommend treatment under anesthesia to people that experience insurmountable fear before treatment and panic when they see a dentist’ chair and his instruments.

fields.title: CERAMIC VENEERS
fields.description:
VENEERS HELP IMPROVE THE FORM AND COLOR OF YOUR TEETH TO GIVE YOU A BEAUTIFUL AND NATURAL SMILE.

With age, our teeth wear down, change colour, chip and crack. But we still want to see a beautiful smile in our reflection in the mirror. Moreover, today, a person’s success is determined by their appearance, and the state of their teeth is one of the important criteria.

This problem can be solved with the help of veneers, a type of fixed restoration. These are custom-made dental overlays (micro-prostheses) in the form of plates that correct defects in the tooth crown.

 

Dental overlays have been used since the 1930s. Perfectly white dental plates were attached just as other dentures. Hollywood celebrities were the first to try them. Modern fixation technology was developed in 1982. Nowadays, it is one of the most popular and reliable methods in aesthetic dentistry and anti-age prosthetics.

 

Indications for Veneers

Veneers are a sparing alternative to crowns. They are installed on the front of a depulped or living tooth, provided that a sufficient surface area is maintained. Only a small amount of tooth enamel is shaved for better contact with the plate. Usually veneers are 0.3 mm to 1.5 mm thick.

 

With modern dental microscopes we can work within the enamel, so the depth of preparation can be reduced to 0.2–0.7 mm. This makes it possible to preserve the enamel, to which the veneer is fixed with its tooth surface, and achieve the desired optical effect. The service life is extended to 10 years; it can be extended if one follows recommendations of the dentist, maintains good oral hygiene and has regular dental visits.

It is possible to change the colour of teeth by 1–2 or more tones.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
STAGES OF TREATMENT

01
ASSESSMENT OF TEETH CONDITION:
Assessment of teeth condition for signs of chipping, increased abrasion, carious foci, and composite fillings.  All this may affect the quality of plate fixation, optical characteristics, and the duration of use.

 
02
COMPUTER MODELLING:
Computer modelling of your smile with modern equipment and software — Digital Smile Design (DSD). Then the project is transferred to the Exocad or inLab software to create 3D reproductions (to print models).

Then the patients are shown how their teeth will look after ceramic restoration. The doctor explains all the details of the process and the final result, which can be assessed and agreed upon before treatment. You can choose several options for prosthetics, adjust the shape, colour, size, and find the optimal solution.

 
03
TOOTH SHAVING OR PREPARATION:
If there is no caries, gum disease or old fillings to change, the dentist will shave the enamel of the front surface of the tooth and scan it. It will also be used to make a ceramic veneer with the help of special software.

 
04
INSTALLATION OF TEMPORARY PLASTIC VENEERS:
They protect the shaved teeth while the permanent veneers are manufactured.

 
05
FITTING OF PERMANENT VENEERS:
All the plates are attached and the accuracy of their fitting to the teeth is evaluated. If required, corrections are made.

 
06
GRINDING AND POLISHING:
Preparation to the fixation to the teeth surface, installation of veneers, and grinding. They are fixed with special cement, which is matched by colour. This is the way to achieve the perfect match of veneers against teeth.

Indications for veneer installation:

- Visible discolouration of the teeth. This includes general darkening (yellowness or staining in a different colour, tetracycline teeth) or appearance of individual spots of different colours.
- Dental Malformation and Malposition.
- Wide interdental spaces.
- Enamel defects, chips, cracks.
- Disproportionately small teeth of the lower or upper jaw.
- Multiple or discoloured fillings are among the consequences of tooth restoration.
 

Veneers of diverse materials are installed in dental clinics in Kyiv. Ceramic veneers are the most durable.

They are manufactured to match the colour and translucency of natural teeth. Typically, 4 to 10 veneers are installed in the smile area, i.e., on the anterior and lateral teeth. Such prostheses have a service life of 10 years, they do not change their colour and retain their lustre, since ceramics resists colouring substances and protects the tooth.

Contraindications include malocclusion, anatomical peculiarities (e. g., low tooth crowns), bad habits, pathological abrasion.

 

Methods for Manufacturing Ceramic Veneers

 

Dental laboratory technicians use various techniques to manufacture veneers:

Layer-by-layer application — a thin foil is swaged around the gypsum model of the tooth, afterwards ceramic mass is layered on it and fired. According to a simplified technique, veneers are made on a refractory model.
 

Injection moulding — first, wax plates are modelled, and then a veneer frame is formed from a softened ceramic block. Then the finished veneer is painted with the appropriate colour.
 

Milling is the fastest and most accurate method for automatic manufacturing of all-ceramic structures (CAD/CAM). This is a fully computerised process preceded by scanning and modelling. The result is high-quality micro-prostheses with a minimum number of visits.
 

Advantages and Disadvantages

The advantages of ceramic veneers include:

- An effective way to correct various defects.
- Predictable result.
- Minimum intervention (compared with crowns) within the enamel with the hard dental tissues and the nerve The gum is not damaged.
- Greater wear resistance, colour stability, smooth surface with lower plaque build-up, which reduces the likelihood of tooth decay.
- Rapid installation.
 
A drawback of veneers is their relatively high cost.

Thorough diagnostics and planning, computer modelling, and manufacturing of all-ceramic products make it possible to combine the requirements for strength and high aesthetic results. With the development of state-of-the-art technology, veneers are increasingly affordable.
fields.features:
Thanks to a digital design we achieve the harmony of your smile with the distinctive features of your face.
Test measurement allows you to see your smile prior to the start of treatment.
High-quality ceramics ensure the transparency and natural tone and tincture of your teeth.
In order that the veneer does not cleave the doctor chooses the corner of its angle for precise contiguity with the adjacent teeth. Veneers do not yield to coloration and do not lose their beauty over time.

fields.title: FIRST APPOINTMENT
fields.description:
THE FIRST APPOINTMENT AT THE PORCELAIN CLINIC IS MORE THAN CONSULTATION.

The objective of our first meeting is to understand what you want, what form of dental care is needed and how much it will cost you.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
WE CONDUCT AN EXAMINATION:
The doctor finds out what is bothering you and conducts an examination of your oral cavity.

 
02
WE DO AN X-RAY:
We have 4 types of X-ray machines, which take pictures right on the spot. All pictures are digital and accessible to you in your mobile telephone applications.

 
03
WE TAKE PHOTOS:
We photograph your face and profile with a smile and without. We also take a picture of your teeth. This allows us to clearly trace the process over the course of treatment.

 
04
WE DRAW UP A DENTAL CARE PLAN:
Our doctor puts together step-by-step plan of action – how many visits are required, what exactly will we do and how much such treatment will cost.

 
05
PRESENTATION:
Our doctor will not only tell you, but show you on a virtual prototype how the treatment will proceed
fields.features:
All stages of the first appointment - the part of European standards, which we closely abide by. You would be treated according to such a scheme in dental clinics abroad.

In an emergency case or if your time is limited, we adapt the first appointment to resolving your problem in one visit.

If the treatment requires surgical intervention the doctor will conduct a virtual operation and will show you everything in detail. You will know for certain what will transpire over the entire time of treatment.

fields.title: CLINICAL WHITENING
fields.description:
QUICK, PROFESSIONAL WHITENING AT THE CLINIC WITH THE HELP OF THE BEYOND SYSTEM.

Quick, professional whitening at the clinic with the help of the Beyond system.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
HYGIENIC TEETH CLEANING:
Hygienic teeth cleaning

 
02
REPLACEMENT OF OLD FILLINGS WHERE NECESSARY:
Replacement of old fillings where necessary

 
03
DETERMINING A COLOR:
Our doctor will help you determine the future tinge of your teeth with the help of samples from an average of 3-5 options

 
04
PROTECTION:
This procedure is comfortable and safe. For this our assistant will put on the patient a pair of protective glasses and a retractor and will apply a balsam to the mouth. A special gel is applied between the teeth and the gums, which will protect the gums from the whitening substance falling into the oral cavity. The doctor applies a special whitening gel to all the necessary teeth

 
05
THE DOCTOR APPLIES A SPECIAL WHITENING GEL TO ALL THE NECESSARY TEETH:
The doctor applies a special whitening gel to all the necessary teeth

 
06
ACTIVATION OF THE GEL:
With an LED-halogen lamp the gel illuminates and the process of whitening begins. This procedure is repeated several times depending on the individual case of the patient

 
07
REDUCING SENSITIVITY:
In order to eliminate enhanced sensitivity and for further protection fluorine is applied to the teeth.
fields.features:
This procedure can be done in one visit.

The state-of-the-art system of whitening is conducted at low temperatures, which ensures that the patient will not experience any unpleasant discomfort.

fields.title: WHITENING TEETH AT HOME
fields.description:
MORE SPARING WHITENING IN HOME CONDITIONS WITH THE HELP OF INDIVIDUAL CAPS

This is an option if the enamel on your teeth is very sensitive, but whitening is desirable and even necessary.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
HYGIENIC CLEANING OF THE TEETH:
Hygienic cleaning of the teeth

 
02
REPLACEMENT OF OLD FILLINGS WHERE NECESSARY:
Replacement of old fillings where necessary

 
03
DETERMINING A COLOR:
Our doctor will help you determine the future tinge of your teeth with the help of samples from an average of 3-5 options

 
04
PREPARATION OF INDIVIDUAL CAPS:
In order the caps firmly adjoin your teeth and do not cause pressure on the edge of the gums, our technician will prepare caps especially for your teeth.

05
WE UNDER TAKE A FLUORIDATION PROCEDURE:
in order to satiate the enamel with micro - element sand avoid unpleasant sensations.
fields.features:
A prepared cap can be put aside and used over some period of time later if you want to restore the whiteness of your teeth.

You can stop the whitening procedure if the achieved tone of your teeth is suitable.

fields.title: CERAMIC INSETS
fields.description:
A CERAMIC FILLING IS NECESSARY IN CASES WHEN THE REAR EVERY FEW TOOTH TISSUES LEFT IN A CONVENTIONAL FILLING AND MOUNTING A CROWN CAN BE AVOIDED.

The main difference of this type of filling is in its material. Ceramics is ideally similar to the enamel of a tooth by its properties.

Such a filling is a modern-day alternative to a composite filling.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
WE CLEAN UP THE CAVITY AND SCAN THE TEETH:
Our doctor prepares teeth for a filling. The doctor scans the teeth with a special camera and gets a 3D model of the jaw and the teeth.This is similar to an ordinary photograph.

 
02
THEN WE SEND THE TOOTH SCAN TO OUR LABORATORY:
The received model of the teeth is uploaded into a cloud service from where our technician downloads it in 5 minutes.

 
03
PREPARATION OF THE FILLING:
A special device cuts out a ceramic filling without human intervention.

 
04
WE MOUNT THE FILLING ONTO THE TOOTH:
The difference between a ceramic filling and a crown is that it preserves the healthier tissues of the tooth. Moreover, it is much more durable than an ordinary filling made of a photo-composite and lasts much longer.
fields.features: We do not use tooth impressions for the preparation of ceramics. Instead, we work on digital models of the teeth. This enhances the precision of the work tenfold and is much more comfortable for our patient.

fields.title: MOUNTING OF IMPLANTS
fields.description:
A HIGH QUALITY IMPLANTATION DEPENDS ON THE DOCTOR’S QUALIFICATIONS, THE QUALITY OF MATERIALS AND THE TECHNOLOGY USED.

Installation of implants is an opportunity to restore a lost tooth without affecting adjacent teeth. They are used as roots for individual crowns.

A tooth is a complex structure that can be disturbed by various diseases. The most common of these are caries and its complications, periodontal diseases. Entire complexes of preventive and therapeutic measures have been developed to prevent such conditions, and doctors are doing their best to preserve patients' natural teeth, but sometimes the removal is inevitable. In this case, the installation of dental implants can be one of the ways to solve the problem of the lack of one or more teeth.

 

It is important to restore the integrity of the dentition as soon as possible. And it's not just an aesthetic issue. Although the inability to smile broadly, the early appearance of wrinkles, the loss of the facial oval sharpness and the sunken cheeks also cause a lot of trouble, especially for women.

 

Tooth loss can also disturb physiological processes, such as digestion, which 90 % of people do not think about. In the oral cavity, mechanical processing of food and the formation of bolus occurs, and this is an important first stage of digestion. In addition, adjacent teeth can be displaced and destroyed, and the jaw can be deformed. As a result, it will be much more difficult to install a dental implant.

 

Indications for implantation
Modern prosthetics based on implants is possible in almost all cases, regardless of the location or extent of a dentition defect.

 

Dental implantation is indicated for:

- the absence of one or more teeth,
- bounded and free-end edentulous spaces,
- complete absence of teeth.
 

Dental implants are especially necessary in cases, where there are no conditions for high-quality attachment of full or partial dentures, as well as intolerance to the materials of which removable prostheses are made.

Contraindications for implant placing
Like other surgical interventions, dental implantation has a number of contraindications. They are divided into absolute and relative contraindications. The first ones include severe chronic diseases: tuberculosis, diseases of the skeletal system, in which the recovery of bones, nervous and cardiovascular systems with circulatory failure and oncological diseases are slowed down.

 

Relative contraindications include dental diseases, such as: stomatitis, periodontitis, malocclusion, diseases of the temporomandibular joint, bruxism, precancerous conditions of the oral mucosa, as well as thyroid pathology, high blood pressure, diabetes mellitus and others.

 

The installation of implants is also undesirable with poor oral hygiene, as this is a direct path to infection of the implant and surrounding tissues, and the development of peri-implantitis with subsequent rejection.

 

Complications of implantation
Complications are divided according to the time of occurrence:

 

- during surgery: injury to adjacent mucous and bone structures, bleeding;
- in the early stages: inflammation of the surrounding tissues, for the prevention of which anti-inflammatory and antibacterial agents are prescribed, oedema, pain, bleeding, discomfort;
- in the long term after the end of prosthetics: complications associated with the fixation of the crown and its deformation, inflammation of the mucosa, the formation of pockets.
 

Specialists in the dental clinics of Kyiv and other cities of Ukraine monitor the development of dental implantology and take all measures to prevent complications, but much depends on the patient himself/herself.

 

Types of implants
Implants are distinguished by the material they are made of. It can be titanium, gold, zirconium, ceramics, glassy carbon and others. The most common of these is titanium. In shape, there are plate, screw, cylindrical, and tubular implants. Most of them have a porous coating, which contributes to its mechanical retention in the jaw bone and biocompatibility with it.

 

Implantation techniques are as follows:

- one-stage implant placement: in this case, the implant is placed in the bone bed, its head protrudes into the oral cavity, and prosthetics begins immediately after the surgery;
- two-stage implant placement: only the root part is placed in the bed, the mucous membrane is sutured above it, prosthetics begins 2-4-6 months (earlier on the lower jaw) after engraftment;
- immediate implant placement: the implant is placed into the alveolar socket immediately after tooth extraction;
- delayed implant placement is performed 2 or more months after tooth extraction, when the bone is completely rebuilt.
 

The cost of a dental implant is determined by many factors: the amount of bone tissue at the implant site and the need to perform additional procedures for its restoration or augmentation, the state of the gums, individual features, technology.

The price for dental implants is discussed with the doctor after initial dental examination, taking into account the number of teeth, which need to be restored.

Care for implants is the same as for natural teeth. Careful oral hygiene is needed to prevent infection and inflammation. Professional cleaning is recommended once every 6 months.

The main thing is not to take too long with implantation, and your health and smile will be safe.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
EXAMINATION:
During a dental examination, the doctor assesses the condition of the oral cavity, dentition, mucous membrane, occlusion, conducts an x-ray examination, determines the possibility of implantation and its specific form.

In addition, in cases where the chronic diseases require monitoring, or the patient takes certain drugs, a number of examinations are conducted to evaluate the overall condition of the body. To do this, blood and urine tests, ECG, as well as a consultation with a therapist or a family doctor are performed.

 
02
VIRTUAL OPERATION:
Virtual model surgery with assessment of the structure and thickness of a bone, as well as the possibility of installing an implant. Implants are selected individually for each patient, depending on the clinical situation and task.

 
03
PREPARATION FOR INSTALLATION:
If there is a lack of bone tissue, the previous bone augmentation is carried out.

 
04
INSTALLING IMPLANTS:
A bed for the implant (its intraosseous part) is formed in the bone tissue; a healing screw is placed above. If this is the lower jaw, the engraftment takes 3 months, on the upper jaw — 4 months.

 
05
MOUNTING OF A CROWN:
Temporary crown installation to create the correct contour of soft tissues (gums).

 
06
PROSTHETICS — INSTALLATION OF THE DENTAL CROWN:
The optimal material, shape and size of the crown are selected. Then it is installed on the abutment and the process is completed.
fields.features:
During implantation, biologically compatible materials are implanted in the jawbone. This means that the process of implant integration is more successful.

The advantages of implants compared to traditional prosthetics:
- Reduction or complete elimination of injury to natural healthy teeth. They do not need to be milled for crowns.

- The ability to restore several teeth at once, including the posterior teeth from 6 to 8, on which the entire dentition rests, using fixed dentures.

- The ability to manufacture fixed dentures even in cases, where there are no teeth at all, as well as improved attachment and fixation of removable dentures.

- The implantation efficacy using modern technologies reaches 97 % and higher.

fields.title: BRACES
fields.description:
BRACE SYSTEMS CORRECT YOUR SMILE AND RESTORE THE PROPORTION OF YOUR FACE.

Abnormal bite is a problem not only of an aesthetic smile and face, but it is also a functional problem resulting in serious consequences for the whole body.

An interesting fact: 80 % of people need orthodontic treatment.

In adult patients and children aged 12 years and over, braces are used to correct the following problems:

- dentofacial anomalies
- teeth overcrowding
- abnormal jaw relation
- tooth displacement after extraction or wisdom teeth cutting
- temporomandibual disorder
- consequences of improper dental prosthetics
 
Orthodontic treatment often prepares the “foundation” for the further work of the implant surgeon and orthopaedic surgeon.

Types of braces
 The duration of bite correction is 1 to 3 years. Therefore, you should be scrupulous about the choice of devices.

The braces can be as follows:
External and internal (vestibular and lingual)

They differ in the place of attachment. Classic braces are attached to the outer, facial surface of the teeth.
Lingual braces are attached to the lingual surface of the teeth. Such a novelty has immediately found enthusiasts who would like to hide the teeth alignment from the surroundings. However, invisible braces have limited indications for installation, a high price and a number of inconveniences associated with wearing them. For example, speech abnormalities and excessive salivation during the period of addiction.

Ligature and self-ligating
The difference between these devices is in the method of attaching the arc to the lock. For this purpose, special elastic ligatures are used.
In self-ligating braces (not to be confused with self-adjustable braces), the lock structure already contains an attachment. Thus, self-ligating devices have immediately become the best option to combine aesthetics and efficacy treatment.

Material
 
Modern orthodontics offers a wide selection of materials of which locks are made. This allows to choose braces for any taste and budget. The braces can be as follows:

1. Metal braces are a time proved classic. Reliable and durable locks are inferior to aesthetics, but most patients can afford them.
2. Ceramic braces are made of special ceramics, the colour of which is as close as possible to the colour of the teeth. Due to this, ceramic braces are almost invisible on the teeth.
3. Sapphire braces are considered the most aesthetic ones. Clear artificial sapphire has only one drawback — fragility. In addition, sapphire braces are often more expensive than the ceramic ones.
4. Plastic braces are a budget option for aesthetes. Their drawbacks are fragility and staining with food. Manufacturers are still working to improve their properties.
5. Combined braces combine two materials: ceramics and metal. Ceramic locks are installed in the smile area, and metal locks — on the posterior teeth. Thus, a compromise between beauty and reliability is achieved.
 
How brackets are fixed

Bracket fixation raises a number of questions for future “braces wearers”, like whether it hurts, how long the procedure is, what you can eat, how to brush your teeth, etc.

The fixation procedure on one jaw takes 1 to 1.5 hours, and is a painstaking process. The orthodontist should place the bracket on the tooth in a special position, only then the whole system will work correctly.

“Each bracket in the device is designed for a certain tooth. This is due to the anatomy of the teeth and their position in the jaw”

Before installing, it is important to treat caries and its complications, and a hygienist should remove plaque.

AFTER FIXATION

In the first minutes, there will be a tickling sensation in your mouth but it will disappear quickly. To prevent possible discomfort due to the fact that the lips rub against the locks, the doctor provides a special protective wax. This is a material which is safe for the body and used to simply patch especially scratching elements.
In the first two days after bracket fixation or replacing the arch or its activation, pain is possible but it will subside on its own.
At the beginning of treatment, it is recommended to minimize the load on the dentition; it is not advisable to bite and gnaw large, solid pieces of food. Avoid sticky and viscous foods.
Full addiction to the braces and the new look takes place within one to two weeks.
Daily attention should be paid to oral hygiene in the morning and evening. On the recommendation of the orthodontist, you can buy special care products — orthodontic brushes — for high-quality cleaning of the braces from plaque.
 
Prices for braces

Before installing braces in Kyiv, it is important for patients to study all the features of the procedure and compare the cost of braces. One should understand that braces themselves have a certain cost, so a low price for installation should set on the alert.
Remember that the result of treatment depends on the experience and knowledge of the orthodontist.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
FIXED JAWS:
The lips and position of the jaws are fixed with a special retractor so that the patient can comfortably keep his/her mouth open throughout the procedure.

 
02
SPECIAL TREATMENT OF TEETH:
Each tooth undergoes a special treatment and air-dried for tight contact between the enamel and the lock.

 
03
INSTALLING BRACES:
A special cement is alternately applied to the teeth and the locks are glued. The residual material around the bracket is removed and illuminated with a photopolymer lamp till complete cement curing. As a rule, the upper jaw is firstly fixed. Fixation to the lower jaw can be carried out immediately or after 1-2 months according to the treatment plan.
 
04
INSTALLING SYSTEM:
All brackets are connected by an orthodontic arch, the ends of which the doctor “hides” so that they do not bother.
fields.features:
The orthodontic department of the clinic involves 5 orthodontists.
The orthodontist begins treatment only after a complete and accurate diagnosis. Diagnosis and planning is carried out on modern equipment on site.
Presentation of the treatment plan — the doctor will describe in detail your clinical case and treatment tactics. You will know and understand all stages of treatment and the budget from installing braces to removing them.
Orthodontists constantly improve their qualifications abroad, with recognized world-class lecturers.
The experience of our doctors is based on modern and proven methods of treatment, as well as the use of materials from leading manufacturers.

fields.title: CAPS
fields.description:
LEVELING OF THE TEETH WITHOUT BRACES

Braces are the most common orthodontic method for correction of occlusion and other teeth alignment disorders. Yet, they are not suitable for everyone and cause certain inconvenience to patients. This prompted the development of new orthodontic technologies. The use of caps (aligners) became an alternative to fixed braces.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
CONSULTATION AND DIAGNOSTICS:
The first step in any orthodontic treatment is examination, diagnosis, and debridement. Caries and gum diseases should be treated before mouth guard installation. Dental calculus is also removed.

 
02:
WORKING GYPSUM MODELS
An orthodontist evaluates the indications for splint making and makes a cast of the teeth. For this, working gypsum models or virtual 3D models are made.

 
03
AGREED OF A TREATMENT PLAN:
The casts, X-rays and photographs of the patient are used to analyse the situation and make up a treatment plan. The final result is visualised by means of computer processing and agreed with the patient.

 
04
PREPARATION OF A SERIES OF CAPS:
Treatment is divided into intermediate results, the so-called computer set-ups, which are used to make an individual set of solid models with the help of 3D printing. They serve as the basis for manufacturing of a required number of aligners.

 
05
TEETH ALIGNMENT:
In the process of correction, the doctor monitors the degree of alterations, treatment stages, and correspondingly changes the splints.

Caps are a removable structure used to move teeth gradually and consistently for their alignment. Their main purpose is to shape a bite that is as close to the physiological one as possible. This is important, since any disorder associated with the position of the upper and lower dentitions relative to each other can cause increased abrasion, reduce their useful life, lead to undesirable changes in the shape of the face, headaches, and other pathological phenomena.

 

Caps are custom-made from a special transparent material on the basis of casts, moulds, or scans of the patient’s teeth. They are very thin, fit the dentitions snugly, bring less discomfort than braces, are easy to wear and take care of.

 

Alignment caps are usually recommended for adolescents above 14 years of age, but sometimes such treatment can be prescribed earlier — at 12 years of age. They should be worn for 20–22 hours a day; changes can be visible in 1–2 months.

 

Indications for Caps Use:

Tremae (lack of contact between the lateral surfaces of the teeth) and diastemae (a gap of more than 1.5 mm between the anterior teeth). Patients may be not bothered by such defects, so they do not always seek help. However, these defects contribute to teeth loosening, uneven load, increased risk of caries, gum disease and further malocclusion, therefore they require correction. An HP makes the decision on the need for correction.
 

Various twists or turns of the anterior teeth. Most often, these are caused by the lack of space for proper positioning of the teeth. Mouth guards ensure that the teeth are relocated to the correct position.
 

Moderate intrusion of the anterior teeth. This concerns tooth immersion into the socket, which is also called a hammered dislocation. The condition can be caused by a fall or a blow into the incisal part of the tooth.
 

Minor cross-bite. Pathology can be associated with both congenital and acquired causes, including caries, severe periodontitis, disordered teeth eruption. In this case, the lower and upper dentitions intersect. The manifestations include asymmetry of the face, constant biting of the mucosa, teeth abrasion.
 

Further treatment with braces. Manufacturers are constantly improving aligner systems, but severe malocclusion, tooth twists, movement or intrusion by more than 2 mm require more complex long-term treatment. Usually it begins with brace installation. In such cases caps are only used at the final stages.
 

 

There are certain contraindications for the use of caps. These include: severe diseases of the internal organs and nervous system, mental disorders, the acute stage of a periodontal disease and other diseases of the oral cavity, jaw maldevelopment, and non-erupted teeth.

 

Aligners are used in the cases when braces are contraindicated, e. g., if a patient needs to move just 1 or 2 teeth or in excessive tooth mobility, when braces deliver too much pressure.

 

The modern technology for the manufacture of aligners involves digital modelling and high-precision computer software, which virtually eliminates possible errors. The treatment is controlled by an orthodontist who uses special software. You can see the result even before the correction begins by means of computer visualisation programmes.

 

The cost of caps depends on the severity of disorders, the number of aligners per course, and the manufacturer.

 

Caps Types

Aligners differ by the materials used, manufacturing methods, and some other characteristics. Caps for occlusion correction can be:

They are manufactured on the basis of a specific template and are ready for use. They are relatively cheap, but the result can be obtained only with minimum malocclusion. They are not used in professional dentistry.
Custom-made. These are the most effective, made on the basis of casts or 3D models of the jaw for each patient individually. They are changed depending on the clinical situation every two weeks until the desired result is achieved.
 
Caps Care

Prior to caps installation, the patient receives all the care recommendations. It is sufficient to wash the aligners daily with running water and brush them with a toothbrush. The patient should control the temperature of the water, since the caps can be deformed subject to high temperatures. Even if the cap does not look dirty, it must be cleaned. Otherwise, microbes can accumulate on its surface, which increases the risk of dental caries and affects the aesthetic appearance of the caps.

Teeth should be cleaned as usual, preferably after each meal. Flossing is also recommended. Enamel is not damaged or abrased by caps. Professional cleaning is provided once every 3–6 months.

 

Duration of Treatment

Even minor movement of teeth is a very slow process, so treatment with orthodontic caps are a time-consuming process. The minimum duration is 4 to 6 months, for more complex disorders it may reach up to 2.5 years. To accelerate changes, one may resort to phased treatment, when at first braces are prescribed, followed by aligners.

Sometimes 1 or 2 months is enough to notice the first results subject to regular use.


Cost of Treatment

The cost of caps depends on the material and the required number of aligners. Even for patients in Kyiv or other Ukrainian cities, original Invisaline caps are custom-made in the USA. On the one hand, such approach guarantees quality, and on the other hand, it makes this treatment method quite expensive.
fields.features:
Cap for teeth: caps for leveling teeth in the clinic Porcelain 1
A dental caps can be easily removed before eating or brushing the teeth. It is almost invisible.
Aligners belong to the most aesthetic orthodontic appliances, which can be used with minimum interference into the patient’s life and help achieve the result — a perfect smile.
Removable devices are made of transparent hypoallergenic materials, do not abrase the enamel, are comfortable (do not irritate the oral mucosa) and hygienic.
Caps do not affect articulation or the shape of the face, their use is combined with other types of treatment.
Caps replacement are quick and easy: the entire kit is made at once depending on the treatment plan.
A set of caps for the whole course of treatment is made in 2–3 weeks.

fields.title: PLATES (OR LAMELLA)
fields.description:
CUTE CHILDREN DON’T ALWAYS BECOME ATTRACTIVE ADOLESCENTS

Parents have one choice: correction with removable plates at the ages of 6 to 10 years or a long-term remedial measure with the help of braces at an older age.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
DIAGNOSTICS:
The purpose of diagnostics – to put together a treatment strategy. For this our doctor analyzes 3 types of X-rays, gypsum models of the jaw and photographs of the child’s face based on which he puts together a step-by-step plan of action.

 
02
PREPARATION AND FIXATION OF PLATES:
In our doctors’ arsenal – more than 50 types of plates. The doctor chooses the treatment method depending on the specific case of the patient.

 
03
CONTROL CHECK-UPS:
Treatment can last for one year or more. On ceor twice a month our doctor must see the child to install the device so that it applies the necessary pressure on the teeth and then he relocates the plates.

 
04
REPLACEMENT OF PLATES:
In certain methods plates should be replaced several times. Every device fulfills its function, which depends on its form and function.
fields.features:
We work by the Orthotropia system – sciences on the course of growth of the face. It proves that when a child is growing the form of its jaw can be altered and create a place for even, permanent teeth.

Our doctors personally learned from John Mew (United Kingdom) – the author of the Orthotropia methodics. This year he was nominated for the Nobel Prize in Medicine.

The result of treatment depends on the doctor’s strategy and the quality of the plate itself. We work with the manufacturers of devices that can technically realize a doctor’s concept.

If the case of your child requires particular methods, the doctor will choose the necessary type of device and the form of treatment. Our doctors belong to exclusive orthodontist’s clubs all over the world and they analyze complex cases together with their colleagues.

fields.title: ORTHO-DIAGNOSTICS
fields.description:
CUTE CHILDREN DON’T ALWAYS BECOME ATTRACTIVE ADOLESCENTS

Parents have one choice: correction with removable plates at the ages of 6 to 10 years or a long-term remedial measure with the help of braces at an older age.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
DIAGNOSTICS:
The purpose of diagnostics – to put together a treatment strategy. For this our doctor analyzes 3 types of X-rays, gypsum models of the jaw and photographs of the child’s face based on which he puts together a step-by-step plan of action.

 
02
PREPARATION AND FIXATION OF PLATES:
In our doctors’ arsenal – more than 50 types of plates. The doctor chooses the treatment method depending on the specific case of the patient.

 
03
CONTROL CHECK-UPS:
Treatment can last for one year or more. On ceor twice a month our doctor must see the child to install the device so that it applies the necessary pressure on the teeth and then he relocates the plates.

 
04
REPLACEMENT OF PLATES:
In certain methods plates should be replaced several times. Every device fulfills its function, which depends on its form and function.
fields.features:
We work by the Orthotropia system – sciences on the course of growth of the face. It proves that when a child is growing the form of its jaw can be altered and create a place for even, permanent teeth.

Our doctors personally learned from John Mew (United Kingdom) – the author of the Orthotropia methodics. This year he was nominated for the Nobel Prize in Medicine.

The result of treatment depends on the doctor’s strategy and the quality of the plate itself. We work with the manufacturers of devices that can technically realize a doctor’s concept.

If the case of your child requires particular methods, the doctor will choose the necessary type of device and the form of treatment. Our doctors belong to exclusive orthodontist’s clubs all over the world and they analyze complex cases together with their colleagues.

fields.title: TEETH CLEANING
fields.description:
PROFESSIONAL CLEANING OF BABY TEETH AT A DENTIST’S OFFICE – GUARANTEE OF HEALTHY PERMANENT TEETH.
Regular cleaning of teeth is a compulsory procedure for children, which will help remove plaque and avoid serious diseases of the oral cavity.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
IN CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 6:
Cleaning is done with the help of a special toothbrush and toothpaste. Our doctor thoroughly works over each tooth and removes all plaque from them.

 
02
AGES 6-9:
A visit to a dentist-hygienist and having the teeth cleaned with professional pastes is compulsory. The fact is neither you nor your child can remove all the plaque from the teeth.

 
03
FROM AGE 9:
A teeth cleaning procedure can be done for adults using the Air Flow system.
fields.features:
Our task is to teach children (and often his or her parents) how to properly brush their teeth. The fact is that it is better to learn how to do this properly from early childhood than in the years of adolescence.

If your child is visiting a dentist for the first time, the doctor will conduct a game-like adaptation to an appointment: he shows your child how all the adaptations and instruments in his office work and tells exactly how the procedure will go.

fields.title: AIRFLOW AND ULTRASOUND
fields.description:
PROPHYLAXIS IS CHEAPER THAN TREATMENT:

Even if you brush your teeth in the morning and evening plaque forms on them, which can only be removed with the help of professional cleaning with special solutions. It is important to remember that every 6 months hygienic cleaning of your teeth must be repeated.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
PREPARATION FOR AN APPOINTMENT:
For your comfort, we put on you a pair of protective glasses, a hygienic mask, and a cloak.

02
ULTRASOUND CLEANING:
Our doctor removes tartar from your teeth under high-frequency fluctuations of water pressure.

03
REMOVAL OF LIGHT PLAQUE WITH THE HELP OF THE AIRFLOW SYSTEM:
This spray contains water, air, and powder. The hygienist thoroughly works on the sections around each tooth and removes the plaque

04
POLISHING:
With the help of a fluorine-based paste, we make your teeth as smooth as ideally possible.

05
EXAMINATION OF A DOCTOR-CURATOR:
The examination by our doctor is included in the fee for a visit.

06
HYGIENE LESSON:
Our doctor will tell you how to properly brush your teeth to get the maximum effect and will recommend additional means of hygiene.
fields.features:
We rejected the use of soda and shifted to a more delicate variant – Calcium or Glycine, which gently remove plaque.
A compulsory element of hygiene – our doctor measures the gingival (gums) pocket of each tooth to identify possible inflammation.
Hygienic cleaning eliminates unpleasant odors of the mouth and remedies of inflammatory processes.

fields.title: VECTOR THERAPY
fields.description:
VECTOR THERAPY – THIS IS A METHOD OF CLEANING THAT PENETRATES DEEPER INTO THE ORAL CAVITY THAN THE STANDARD PROCEDURE OF REMOVAL OF TARTAR AND PLAQUE.

Periodontium is a complex of tissues which surrounds each tooth. It consists of ligaments, gums, tooth cement, periodontium and alveolaris processus. Its main role is to fix and hold the tooth in the bone hole. In addition, it provides blood supply due to a large number of blood and lymph vessels, contains many nerve receptors, allows to evenly distribute mastication load throughout the dentition and protects against infections.

 

Periodontal diseases
Periodontists are involved in the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of periodontal diseases, among which the most common inflammatory diseases are periodontitis, as well as dystrophic processes (parodontosis).

The development of chronic inflammation is accompanied by destruction of the alveolar tissues, which can lead to tooth loss. According to statistics, periodontitis is most often diagnosed in pregnant women and patients with diabetes mellitus.

 

The severity of periodontitis is determined by:

- the depth of periodontal pocket,
- the degree of bone loss,
- tooth mobility.
 

There are several stages of the disease, and the consequences are not limited to the oral cavity. There may be disorders in the digestive system; immunity is reduced, cardiovascular diseases occur, and the psychoemotional sphere suffers.

 

The main symptoms of periodontitis: bleeding, bad breath, increased tooth mobility, gum inflammation, its low level and lengthening of the cervical margin of tooth which entails aesthetic problems.

 

The main reason for the development of inflammatory processes is poor hygiene and the accumulation of pathogens on the subgingival surface of the tooth root. The breeding ground for them is food debris. During the bacterial breakdown which forms the biofilm, a large number of toxins are released, which triggers immune reactions and destroys periodontium. Therefore, the main tactics to prevent periodontitis and the first stage of therapy is professional hygiene. Treatment should be initiated as early as possible, and its main goal is to remove dental deposits, bacteria, pathogens from the surface and restore the gingival attachment.

 
Treatment of periodontal diseases
The modern treatment of periodontitis and parodontosis at the initial stage involves the refusal of surgical intervention in favour of conservative methods to clean the gingival pockets using ultrasound and other equipment techniques.

Vector therapy is the most gentle method based on the effect of ultrasound and a special calcium hydroxyapatite suspension, which increases the efficacy of root cleaning, and the periodontal pocket is intensively treated and washed.

 

Vector tooth cleaning, as the first stage of treatment, allows to get rid of subgingival and supragingival dental deposits, cope with soft tissue inflammation and polish the root surface.

Our clinic uses an advanced Vector system (Vector apparatus manufactured by Dürr Dental, Germany).

Vector Therapy Results
Treatment of periodontal diseases with Vector allows to avoid even greater exposure of the cervical margin of a tooth and to reduce the depth of periodontal pockets due to the attachment of a gum.

 

Patients note:

- reduced bleeding,
- lack of bad smell,
- a feeling of clean mouth.
 

To fix the effect and prevent exacerbations of periodontitis, it is necessary to regularly undergo an examination and repeat the supporting procedures.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
REMOVAL OF PLAQUE AND TARTAR:
Initially, the removal of light plaque and tartar with the help of Air-Flow and ultrasound is compulsory.

 
02
IDENTIFYING THE STAGE OF GINGIVAL INFLAMMATION:
For this during the cleaning process the hygienist measures the depth of the gingival pocket around each tooth.

 
03
DEEP CLEANING OF ROOTS:
Our doctor inserts a special nozzle in between the gums and the roots of the teeth. The tip of the nozzle collects germs or bacteria and toxins, which cause inflammation. The surface of the root is thoroughly cleaned and polished. The procedure takes from 2 to 3 hours.

 
04
GUM CONTROL AFTER 3 MONTHS:
We check how the gums are feeling and put together a plan of action for prophylaxis of the inflammation.
fields.features:
Advantages of the method:
 

- during cleaning, the doctor may control the vibrational amplitude of the tip, which reduces the injuries during the procedure,
- suspension particles polish the root surface in a quality manner even in hard-to-reach places,
- no aerosol cloud
- the pocket is extensively washed without damaging the soft tissues,
- bacteria, biofilm and calculus are effectively removed.
 

The treatment of periodontitis with the Vector device is painless; there is no hypersensitivity after cleaning that's why patients are positive about this method. There is no need for anaesthesia as well.

The treatment of gums with the Vector device is performed at the micro level. Hydroxyapatite has an antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory and stimulating effect, so the tissues quickly recover after the procedure.

fields.title: CURETTAGE
fields.description:
AN EFFECTIVE METHOD OF TREATMENT OF GUM DISEASE – GINGIVITIS AND PARADONTITIS.

Curettage of paradontal pockets is done to remove tooth tartar, plaque and pathologically changes soft tissues under the gums, which are impossible to remove during cleaning.

Smoothening of the surfaces of tooth roots helps fortify the gums to surfaces and reduces the depths of pockets.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
DEFINING THE FORM OF CURETTAGE:
Depend in gon the degree of in flammation of the gums and the depth of the pockets, our paradontologist assigns the curettage by an open or closed method.

 
02
PLAQUE AND BACTERIA A REMOVED WITH FINE INSTRUMENTS:
The surfaces of the roots are cleaned to the very bottom of the paradontal pocket. Soft tissues are not damaged in the process. Treatment is done under anesthetics, painlessly and comfortably.

 
03
CONTROL IN 3 MONTHS:
We check changes in the depth of the dental pockets and put draw up a plan of action for prophylaxis of inflammation.
fields.features:
Our paradontologists conduct a comprehensive procedure aimed at reducing inflammation of the gums. This allows for stopping the process of decay of bones in the case of paradontitis.

Precise control on the part of our doctor–we register the status of the gums and track the dynamics of changes.

fields.title: TREATMENT UNDER ANESTHESIA
fields.description:
THE POSSIBILITY OF TREATING YOUR TEETH WHILE YOU ARE RELAXING AND WATCHING A DREAM IN YOUR SLEEP.

You are put to sleep with the help of an American gas called Sevoran. As a result, the patient feels calm and relaxed and falls into a state of an easily interruptible sleep during the entire operation.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
CONSULTATION WITH A DOCTOR AND AN ANESTHESIOLOGIST:
You will find out how to most effectively and comfortably undergo treatment. After that you give your analyses to get an idea of the general background of your health.

 
02
TREATMENT:
You take a few deep breaths and fall into a medication induced sleep. During your sleep you feel nothing and don’t remember anything. Thanks to one 3-hour visit during which you are floating in a light dream the doctor manages to do the same work that would usually require 4-5 visits.

 
03
AWAKENING:
You wake up in a cozy room for relaxation just like it would be after a usual healthy sleep in your own bed at home.
fields.features:
IN EVERY PARTICULAR CASE THE TYPES OF ANESTHESIA AND MEDICATIONS ARE CHOSEN FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL TAKING INTO ACCOUNT ALL SPECIFIC PARTICULARITIES OF THE BODY AND THE VOLUME OF TREATMENT.

Comfort and safety of the patient’s visit is ensured by constant supervision of the anesthesiologist and the dynamic control of special equipment.

A certified American gas called Sevoran helps the patient fall asleep.

fields.title: FILLINGS KIDS
fields.description:
WE PRESERVE THE HEAL THE SMILE OF YOUNGSTERS FROM THE VERY FIRST TOOTH

Modern-day parents know all too well that baby teeth must be treated!

Up on the first signs of cavities in a child's baby teeth, we recommend not postponing a visit to a dentist.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
ACQUAINTANCE (GET-TO-KNOW-YOU VISIT):
A visit to a dentist is a huge leap for a child. In a game format a doctor does a check-up of a child’s oral cavity, makes a safe X-ray and determines the degree to which the cavity has damaged the tooth.

 
02
WE CLEAN THE CAVITY AND PUTIN FILLING:
It is difficult for children to sit in a dentist’s chain for long. So, the actions of the doctor are concisely developed and take a minimum amount of time. While the doctor is working, the child can watch his or her favorite cartoon on a wide screen TV.

 
03
A SURPRISE FOR BRAVERY:
When The Treatment Is over,the child will definitely receive a pleasant surprise for its show of bravery, as well as a fascinating card of the adventures of “Cosmo tooth”.
fields.features:
Children’s doctors by their calling. They love their work and conduct cautious and caring treatment.

We conduct treatment of cavities in children in compliance with modern international standards using the most state-of-the-art materials. Photo-polymer fillings restore baby teeth and preserve their functions until replacement with permanent teeth.

A game zone, cartoons, a mini-library and even a children’s menu in the clinic’s café – we tried our best to create conditions for your child’s comfortable and pleasant stay at the dentist’s office.

fields.title: SEALING OF FISSURES
fields.description:
A PREVENTATIVE PROCEDURE THAT REDUCES THE RISK OF THE FORMATION OF CAVITIES.

Recesses in the teeth (fissures) are covered with a special hermetic seal, which prevents food from getting caught in the recess as a result of which bacteriaforms. This helps secure and preserve the chewing teeth for 1.5-2 years.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
PROFESSIONAL CLEANING:
The teeth must be prepared for sealing by removing all plaque and bacteria from the teeth prior to cleaning.

 
02
RINSING THE TEETH FROM BACTERIA USING A SPECIAL SOLUTION:
from bacteria using a special solution.

 
03
APPLICATION OF THE SEAL:
Application of the seal.

 
04
ILLUMINATION WITH A PHOTO-POLYMER LAMP:
Illumination with a photo-polymer lamp.

 
05
COVERING WITH FLUORIDE:
Covering with fluoride.
fields.features:
Reduces the risk of the appearance of cavities by 40-60%

Procedures take 5-10 on average for each tooth.

Painless procedure.

With time the hermetic seal disappears on its own by a mechanical method.

fields.title: TREATMENT OF CANALS
fields.description:
WE SAVE TEETH FROM EXTRACTION

Treatment of canals under a microscope – this is a precise examination of an affected tooth for the quick removal of the source of pain. This technique allows to effectively work with complicated cases and restore a tooth after poor quality work.
fields.stages_of_treatment:
01
DIAGNOSTICS:
We take precise X-rays and find the source of pain.

 
02
ANESTHESIA AND ISOLATION OF A TOOTH:
We dress on a latex napkin, which isolates remaining teeth and the mouth from solutions falling into the oral cavity. We anesthetize your mouth so that you do not feel any discomfort.

 
03
CLEANING OF CANALS:
Our doctor chooses an instrument for maximum quality of cleaning teeth canals. He uses Leica and Global microscopes and accurately cleans the damaged sections of your teeth while preserving the healthier fibers.

 
04
CLEANING WITH A CHEMICAL SOLUTION:
Our doctor cleans Remains Of Pulp (nerves) and micro-bacteria out of your teeth canals to achieve their maximum sterility.

 
05
FILLING OF A CANAL:
We use gutta-percha (rubber) in a liquid form and under pressure it ideally fills all branches of a canal. Thanks to this voids and crevices in which bacteria can form disappear. .

 
06
MOUNTING OF SURFACES:
Our doctor mounts a filling or a crown. The canal is closed and sterile.
fields.features: Treatment of canals under a microscope – this is a precise examination of an affected tooth for the quick removal of the source of pain. This technique allows to effectively work with complicated cases and restore a tooth after poor quality work.
